title: Former Aston Villa owner Tony Xia responds after arrest warrant issued in China
text:

Former Aston Villa owner Tony Xia has broken his silence on social media after a Chinese court issued a warrant for his arrest in Beijing.

Xia, who took charge at Villa Park in 2016, left the club on the brink of administration after a gamble to get back into the Premier League backfired.

They were saved by billionaire owners Nassef Sawiris and Wes Edens in the summer of 2018, with Xia remaining on the board until August this year when he failed to pay a £30million debt to previous owner Randy Lerner after their promotion.

A string of investors are now believed to be chasing him for his money back, with his Recon Group sued for breach of contract and non-payment of debts.

Wanted posters have been distributed offering more than £30,000 as reward for information regarding the whereabouts of the businessman, with court documents revealing he owes nearly £13million.

(Image: Birmingham Mail)

But Xia, who is currently barred from leaving the country with a judge ordering he be detained, has taken to Twitter to offer his response.

He wrote: "Ironical experience as I was trapped by competitor while I been away China.I haven’t been arrested as born out by being able to send this tweet. I am not in hiding.

"The claims are false &been created by a local competitor attempting to cause damage to me. Legal action to follow.

"Also very FUNNY how some people talk when they wanted to take Villa into administration which would have meant -12 points &a very bleak future, but asking for extra payment for himself.

"I NEVER regretful for what I tried for beloved AV including the best exit in circumstances!

"I took only one word ‘ VERITAS’with me when I completed my education at Harvard and followed it since then.

"Though there are very different in many ways in my home country but you can never hate your mother for anything you disagree or dislike. Was hoping sports can embrace ALL!"

Xia was outspoken on Twitter during his tenure at Villa Park but had not posted on the site since August 23.
description: Aston Villa's controversial former owner Tony Xia has broken his silence on social media after an arrest warrant was issued
